node.title: How to reduce the chances of your Christmas party turning intoÂ a superspreader event
node.alt: People gather round the table for Christmas lunch
node.description: COVID-19 infections are expected to rise over the holiday season, but there are steps we can put in place to reduce the chance of accidentally spreading infections.
node.content:
["Preparing for a big family get-together can be stressful enough.", "Throw in COVID-19 and the anxiety around ensuring your party does not turn into a superspreader event, and things can get downright overwhelming.", "That's how Denny Meadows, from Melbourne's inner-east, feels.", "He and his partner are throwing a small Christmas lunch with about a dozen friends and family members.", "What he is most concerned about is protecting two elderly guests from contracting the virus.", "\"My greatest fear is that the two women in their 90s would get COVID,\" he said.", "\"This year we're concerned, I guess principally because of Omicron, and the fact that Omicron seems to be resistant to vaccination.\"", "Vaccines continue to offer protection against severe disease and death, but early studies suggest they are less effective against the Omicron variant, making Mr Meadows worry\u00a0about the safety of his guests.", "With tens of thousands of COVID-19 cases in the community, including an increasing number of Omicron infections, the virus is expected to spread further as Australians gather over the festive season.", "And now that most\u00a0government-mandated restrictions have eased, it is up to individuals like Mr Meadows to set COVID-safe rules at their events.", "So how can we celebrate with loved ones while reducing the risk of getting anyone seriously ill?", "Here are some tips on balancing the COVID-19 outbreak with your Christmas plans.", "
Alfresco celebrations are a good idea
", "Mr Meadows has already come up with a few options to keep his guests safer over Christmas lunch.", "\"We're hoping we can have it outdoors, because of the risks,\" he said.", "\"It'll depend on the weather, obviously. We've got some shaded areas where older people can stay so that's good.\"", "", "
Reducing harm is a good way to think about managing COVID-19 during Christmas, says Professor Margaret Hellard.(Supplied: Burnet Institute)
", "Margaret Hellard, deputy director of the Burnet Institute, said gathering outdoors was one of the \"simple things\" people could do to reduce the likelihood of infections spreading.", "\"Try not to be really crowded in one small space,\" she said.", "That could mean opening windows and doors to make sure there is a constant airflow during an indoor gathering.", "If you can't get outside or improve ventilation, masks are also a good way to reduce transmission.", "University of Melbourne professor of epidemiology Tony Blakely said two people wearing masks reduced their chances of catching COVID-19 by more than 75 per cent.", "\"If we're going out for social events around Christmas time, keep the mask on as much as you can,\" he said.", "", "
Gathering outdoors when eating or drinking is a good way to manage the risk of COVID-19 exposure during Christmas.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "
What to do with unvaccinated guests?
", "Mr Meadows and his partner have decided unvaccinated guests will not be allowed to attend their Christmas lunch.", "\"We don't want to exclude people.\u00a0Unless, of course, they're not vaccinated,\" he said.", "Vaccination remains the best way to reduce your\u00a0chance of getting sick and spreading COVID-19, and Professor\u00a0Hellard said hosts should not shy away from checking the vaccination status of invitees.", "But what if your guest is unvaccinated and you still want them at your Christmas dinner?", "Professor Hellard said there were some ways you could reduce the risk of that person spreading an infection at your party.", "\"It might be that they definitely have a test before they come in\u00a0on the day,\" she said.", "\"[Or] they can wear a mask.\"", "", "
Asking unvaccinated guests to wear masks is one way to lessen the risk that they pass on an infection.(ABC News: Matt Bamford)
", "Hosts could also ask unvaccinated guests to take steps to limit their exposure in the lead-up to the event.", "That might mean asking them to stay at home and avoid large gatherings in the days prior.", "\"What you do is you say, 'You're welcome to come, but would you consider doing this please?'\" Professor\u00a0Hellard said.", "\"You're not asking somebody to be vaccinated, but you're asking them to think about how they can reduce their risk.\"", "
Take special care of the vulnerable
", "No one wants to give grandma COVID-19 for Christmas.", "So, it is important to be extra cautious around elderly or vulnerable guests during the holidays.", "", "
Professor Tony Blakely says a rise in infections over the holidays is \"inevitable\" but there are things we can do to reduce the risk.(Supplied)
", "Professor Blakely suggested that people concerned about their health might want to limit the number of social gatherings they attend.", "\"I'm not trying to say that people don't go see the grandkids on Christmas,\" he said.", "\"But if you're frail \u2026 you probably don't want to go to big business parties. Just focus on what time you have with people who are the most important to you.\"", "Other guests can also take special precautions around the sick or elderly, like wearing masks or meeting them outdoors.", "\"It's really important that we try [to]\u00a0protect the vulnerable in our communities,\" Professor\u00a0Hellard said.", "
To test or not to test?
", "Mr Meadows said he was considering asking guests to get a rapid antigen test before the party, but got stumped by the logistics.", "\"I wasn't sure when I should do it, because I know rapid antigen tests can throw up false positives,\" he said.", "\"So, it would only be fair to give people time to get the PCR test, which I think takes up to three days for results.\"", "", "
Denny Meadows is considering asking guests to take\u00a0a rapid antigen test before attending his Christmas lunch.(Reuters: Denis Balibouse)
", "Professor Hellard said taking a rapid antigen test a couple days before an event, and on the day of,\u00a0is an effective way to reduce the possibility of transmitting COVID-19.", "The tests can be purchased over the counter at pharmacies or some supermarkets for about $30 for a pack of two.", "\"A few tests in a row a couple of days before are really quite effective,\" she said.", "\"Not as effective as, say, a standard RNA test, but a few tests in a row could be really helpful.\"", "The Burnet Institute deputy director\u00a0said that,\u00a0if people were particularly anxious about infecting older people, at-home tests provided a good \"harm-reduction approach\".", "\"It's not perfect.\u00a0It doesn't mean that you might not have COVID, and you have to have a couple of tests,\" she said.", "\"But it reduces the likelihood of harm coming [to someone].\"", "
'A very tricky and confusing time'
", "Above all, experts say, we need to be realistic as we enter the holiday period, and balance the risk of transmitting COVID-19 with our desire to see friends and family.", "Professor\u00a0Hellard said the ability to completely avoid the chance of catching COVID-19 over Christmas was impossible, but that did\u00a0not mean we should not\u00a0take steps to avoid it.", "\"When there's COVID in the community, wherever you've got people gathering together, then there's a risk of the transmission of infection,\" she\u00a0said.", "The rapid uptake in vaccinations has given many Australians peace of mind\u00a0but, Professor Blakely said, a recent surge in infections in NSW gives us an indication of the outbreak's trajectory.", "\"Now the vaccines have started to wane, and people haven't been boosted and they're out and about with Christmas, up it goes,\" he said.", "\"So it is actually s very tricky and confusing time and it's not possible for me to give completely black-and-white advice here.", "Despite the uncertainty, adopting simple COVID-safe measures such as\u00a0masks, testing, eating outdoors and ensuring guests\u00a0get their booster shots when eligible, can help us\u00a0reduce the chance of catching COVID-19 or accidentally passing it to someone else.", "", "
Infections are set to rise over the coming weeks, but that doesn't mean we need to cancel holoiday plans.(ABC News: Danielle Bonica)
", "In Melbourne, Mr Meadows said\u00a0he was looking forward to reading these tips to make sure his lunch was both fun and did not\u00a0end with his guests falling ill.", "\"I'm just interested in any suggestions to make my Christmas safer,\" he said.", "", "
What the experts know about the Omicron variant so far(Norman Swan)
"]
